Meta Description 1: Your expert resource for VLSI Physical Design. Explore comprehensive guides on logic synthesis, floorplanning, placement, CTS, and other core concepts.
Comprehensive educational guide on advanced logic synthesis and physical implementation, including physical synthesis, CCD, multibit banking, and power optimization.
High-level guide to IO ring planning, pad placement, ESD, and package constraints.
Why ECOs are used, how they are implemented, and how to reduce risk.
An in-depth technical guide to Composite Current Source (CCS) modeling in VLSI, covering NLDM vs. CCS, driver/receiver models, Liberty syntax, and CCSN for noise analysis.
A comprehensive guide to the VLSI placement stage, detailing goals, algorithms, optimization techniques, and the impact on timing and routability.
Overview of dynamic and leakage power, activity modeling, and analysis flow.
A comprehensive guide to the VLSI routing stage, covering global and detailed routing, algorithms like maze routing, and key challenges such as congestion and signal integrity.
A compact overview of STA concepts, timing paths, slack, and signoff checks.
A guide to logic synthesis, covering the process from RTL to gate-level netlist, optimization techniques, and technology mapping.
Static and dynamic IR drop analysis, causes, and mitigation techniques.
An in-depth guide to VLSI power planning, covering the power distribution network (PDN), power integrity analysis (IR drop, EM), and low-power design techniques using UPF.
Summary of delay models used for STA, including NLDM and CCS, and how slew and load affect timing.
Introduction and professional background of Samson Hruday Chinta.
A deep dive into the fundamentals of CMOS technology for VLSI design, covering semiconductor physics, PN junctions, MOSFET operation, and second-order effects.
A collection of articles, insights, and updates on VLSI Physical Design.
A comprehensive guide to the essential libraries and data inputs for VLSI physical design, including netlists, SDC, LEF, LIB, and technology files.
Typical PD issues and practical fixes for timing, congestion, power integrity, and DRC.
Understand routing congestion, how to measure it, and strategies to reduce hotspots.
A consolidated list of references and sources cited across all articles on the VLSI Physical Design Hub.
Simple numerical examples to interpret setup/hold slack and path delay calculations.
An in-depth guide to VLSI floorplanning, covering core objectives, macro placement, power planning, and strategies for achieving an optimal chip layout.
Overview of standard cell categories, drive strengths, Vt flavors, and special-purpose cells used in physical design.
Purpose and usage of tap cells, endcaps, fillers, tie cells, and decap cells.
Overview of PD signoff checks: DRC, LVS, STA, EM/IR, and signal integrity.
A deep dive into Clock Tree Synthesis (CTS), covering fundamentals, architectures like mesh and H-tree, low-power techniques, and advanced challenges.
Information about the VLSI Physical Design Hub and how to get in contact.
A collection of projects and case studies in VLSI Physical Design.
An expert report on advanced VLSI synthesis, including physical-aware synthesis, DFT, power optimization, and timing closure techniques like WNS/TNS optimization.
